definition: to cast a fishing net/(computing) to go offline
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.
sentences.chinese: 他们便撒下网去，竟拉不上来了，因为鱼甚多。

sentences.english: Rhema I will let down the net .
sentences.chinese: 但依从你的话，我就下网。

sentences.english: But because you say so, I will let down the nets.
sentences.chinese: 但依从你的话，我就下网。

sentences.english: They cast therefore, and they were no longer able to haul it in because of the abundance of fish.
sentences.chinese: 他们便撒下网去，竟拉不上来，因为鱼甚多。

sentences.english: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon.
sentences.chinese: 讲完了，对西门说，把船开到水深之处，下网打鱼。

sentences.english: Spin net knife, brush with wool dropping net.
sentences.chinese: 旋下网刀，用毛刷将胡须屑刷净。

sentences.english: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
sentences.chinese: 讲完了，对西门说，把船开到水深之处，下网打鱼。

definition: to serve the ball/to tee off
to net sth/to catch sth with a net
to intercept at the net (volleyball, tennis etc)/to block
variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
variant of 漁汛|渔汛[yu2 xun4]
to fish with a hook and bait
to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
